p: Rosin-based waterborne polyurethanes can be prepared from maleopimaric acid, diethylene glycol, polyether glycol, toluene diisocyanate, dimethylol propionic acid and trimethylamine according to Scheme 60, and using such separation methods as vacuum drying and rotary evaporation [ 111]. Such polymers can be also synthesized using fumaropimaric rosin instead of maleopimaric acid [ 109]. These materials exhibit excellent mechanical properties, thermal stability, water resistance, antimicrobial properties against Gram-negative Escherichia coli and Gram-positive Staphylococcus aureus [ 109, 111] and an affinity for cellulose nanocrystals [ 112], which allows to apply them in various biomass-based polymer and composite materials.
